title: Sheldon Adelson
summary: Sheldon Gary Adelson (/ˈædəlsən/; August 4, 1933 – January 11, 2021) was an American businessman,[2] investor, political donor and philanthropist.[3][4][5] He was the founder, chairman and chief executive officer of Las Vegas Sands Corporation, which owns the Marina Bay Sands in Singapore, and the parent company of Venetian Macao Limited, which operates The Venetian Las Vegas and the Sands Expo and Convention Center. He owned the Israeli daily newspaper Israel Hayom, the Israeli weekly newspaper Makor Rishon, and the American daily newspaper the Las Vegas Review-Journal.[6][7]
